lines.text: I must have loved you all along, but I always thought of you as a child.
Every morning you come in here and tidy up his room.
Well, it needs a woman's touch.
Yes, but who gets the credit for it? Me! He thinks I bring him spring flowers. Flowers, huh! I wonder what kind of man he thinks I am!
I've observed that teachers whho are browbeaten at home are inclined to take their revenge in school.
Anybody who pokes around in the garbage can shouldn't be surprised when he finds garbage.

[to Marie]
What will it take to cheer you up? A diamond bracelet, a million francs, or a dance with me?
Isn't it strange how professors can be so pitifully stupid? It's taken me all these weeks to find out that the only answer to the problem...is you.
I could have told you that.
